intro: Pinnasa pinnatifida, commonly known as the narrow-leaved pinnasa, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its slender, pinnately divided leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
